body_html:
@larry-fuy I think that your question isn's same with me.

Have you ever built tensorflow r0.11rc0 version with avx support?
When I built many tensorflow version(r0.9, r0.10rc0, r0.10, r0.11rc0), only tensorflow r0.10 had avx error. So, I suggest that you try to build other version.

In addition, If your machine is Intel Haswell, try to type '--copt=-mavx2' instead of '--copt=mavx' and before you build, please type 'bazel clean'.

body:
@larry-fuy I think that your question isn's same with me.

Have you ever built tensorflow r0.11rc0 version with avx support?
When I built many tensorflow version(r0.9, r0.10rc0, r0.10, r0.11rc0), only tensorflow r0.10 had avx error. So, I suggest that you try to build other version.

In addition, If your machine is Intel Haswell, try to type '--copt=-mavx2' instead of '--copt=mavx' and before you build, please type 'bazel clean'.
